subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: ITC Photos--Question
author: Misty Dawn
full_text:
--0-472966918-1196462955=:83794
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi Rita,
   
  There are many methods for recording imagery just as there are many for recording voices. I gave a quick breakdown for a few of them I've used on my page (which still needs updating LOL) and many others have websites built around the subject. I havent had alot of time to spend on it but when I do the results are sometimes worth the wait. I wish I had all day to spend on research when I want to. I'd try alot more things just out of curiousity sake alone along with things they mention.
   
  I dont think I posted any of my pics in the file area, I made the gallery instead. You can view it if you find any of the methods interest you and want to see examples. Ive posted a few hundred there so far. the good, the bad, the "what the heck is that" and the stereogram type. 
   
  Some are whole faces of someone I knew, as for the rest your on your own as to who/what you may or may not see. I need to update that again too and add new stuff LOL
   
  Anyway you can try a few methods and see whats working well for you.
  http://misty.xm.com/tech.html
  http://webcamitc.myphotoalbum.com/
   
  Keith also has some great itc images using different methods
  http://www.itcbridge.com
   
  Lauras been experimenting in a few new ways
  http://www.esnips.com/user/ITCExperimenter
   
  Lance has been experimenting alot lately
  http://www.ukevpresearch.com/index.htm
   
  yeah yeah I know I left some of you out but you can post your own dang links to your sites
   
  
   
  Misty
   
   
   
   
  Rita <nvrenuf1031@...> wrote:
          How do you do it is the question, I quess? Are folks just videotaping, 
or taking pictures of blank TV screens (TV turned off) during an ITC-
EVP session?



                         

       
---------------------------------
Be a better pen pal. Text or chat with friends inside Yahoo! Mail. See how.
